Work Experience

  • Co-founder and CTO,  Doctible, Inc. May, 2014 - Present

    Technical Co-founder of Doctible. Responsible for all aspects of technology vision, software development and deployment, system administrations, and overall architecture design.

    Designed, developed, and deployed multiple infrastructures including booking, scheduling and provider managment from the ground up to host nation's first cash marketplace to connect patients and medical practices.

    Also the Lead Developer of a small development team while hiring and managing senior/junior team members. Helped Doctible's acceptance of Evonexus, a San Diego tech incurbator.

  • Senior Software Engineer,  QualcommMarch, 2010 - May, 2014

    A member of the web/mobile development team for a Contexual Aware Platform leveaging Geofencing and Bluetooth Beacons (including iBeacon™). The project later was spinned out of Qualcomm Labs to become Gimbal.

    Developed various prototypes of content delivering mobile applications to discover interactions with Bluetooth Beacons. Help building the foundation of a complex and reliable backend system of beacon management, as well as an intuitive user portal. Lead the early research of integration between the existing platform and Apple's iBeacon™. Participated in multiple Hackerthons on project's behalf.

  • Software Engineer,  Tapioca MobileJuly, 2008 - Feb, 2010

    Part of the development team building a video transcoding and distribution system via MMS and SMS. The company was later acquired by Qualcomm.

    Re-designed a background-job system for video transcoding to replace the old one; boosted reliability and performance by thirty-percent in speed. Later created an url shortening platform with focus on optimized mobile experience for various mass-market phones and smart-phones.

    Direct customer interactions with Univision product managers on various feature requests to deliver and setup multiple national television campaigns.

  • User Consultant,  San Diego Super Computer CenterSept, 2006 - June, 2008

    Provided support to computational science researchers using High-Performance Computing (HPC) softwares.

    Installing, configuring and maintaining HPC application support software on HPC (Unix and Windows based) systems.
